message: It's packed so full of customers that they can barely move.
And they're all...<K> missing their faces.
They have only bright red mouths, open wide in glee, tongues wriggling like worms.
Even stranger, I can hear every word of their conversations.
The voices pierce my mind like arrows. The noise is unbearable.
There's no way this is real.

Is it a dream, then?<k>
Am I... dreaming?
But now, I'm certain that I've felt this before.
When Noiz pulled me into Rhyme.
But the voices drown out my thoughts before they can take form.
I feel a warm sensation in my ears. When I reach up to touch them, something sticky drips out.
Letters are floating in the liquid.
The words! They died inside my skull and became this black filth.
I really hope this is just a dream.
Either way, I need to find a way out.
I look around, but just then, I suddenly realize that I'm being watched.
When I turn around, I see a familiar face pass by.
Amid the rows of featureless heads, this one has a face.
I push my way through the faceless, babbling crowd, making my way to the back of the shop.
The tattoo studio is through this door. I open it and dash inside.
